text: Is there an updated tutorial on VI for BNNs anywhere on the interwebs? From what I understand the Turing tutorials are largely being rewritten and the current one seems to be outdated. Thanks!

elements.text: Is there an updated tutorial on VI for BNNs anywhere on the interwebs? From what I understand the Turing tutorials are largely being rewritten and the current one seems to be outdated. Thanks!

text: There's <https://github.com/TuringLang/TuringTutorials/pull/84|https://github.com/TuringLang/TuringTutorials/pull/84> which I never finished, but it's a good reminder :D I should get it done

text: There seems to be larger changes needed first, so for now I can send you the latest version working under the latest version of Turing

text: Actually, a quick question if you don't mind. How large models are reasonable to fit with ADVI would you say?

elements.text: Actually, a quick question if you don't mind. How large models are reasonable to fit with ADVI would you say?

text: If you use CUDA you can fit virtually anything

elements.text: If you use CUDA you can fit virtually anything

text: But this require some extra steps, maybe I should complete the tutorial on how to use the GPU

elements.text: But this require some extra steps, maybe I should complete the tutorial on how to use the GPU

text: The most general question is: does VI makes sense for large models! But that's another question :D

text: Thank you for responding! Yeah, I was thinking in more practical terms. Analysing the resulting fit another story :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Is it supposed to work on the GPU like when doing regular MAP estimates with Flux? As in: you move the model and the data to the GPU and it Just Works(tm)? I tried this but it didn't print any progress so I suspect there might be more to it

elements.text: Is it supposed to work on the GPU like when doing regular MAP estimates with Flux? As in: you move the model and the data to the GPU and it Just Works(tm)? I tried this but it didn't print any progress so I suspect there might be more to it

text: Yeah you need to pass the priors, the data and the nn itself to the GPU. It worked out of the box for me

elements.text: Yeah you need to pass the priors, the data and the nn itself to the GPU. It worked out of the box for me
